children.name: core
children.title: Decentology Modules
children.description: Modules created and maintained by Decentology

children.name: community
children.title: Community Modules
children.description: Modules created and maintained by community members

name: blockchains
title: Blockchains
description: Blockchains are the underlying technology for the decentralized web. If you aren't familiar with  the decentralized web, it's a good idea to get some familiarity with how it works before you start. There are numerous public and private blockchains (we will support many of them soon).

name: languages
title: Languages
description: Different blockchains use different languages. Some blockchains use one language while others use several languages.

help.title: Learn more about languages used for each blockchain.

name: frameworks
title: Frameworks
description: The UI of your dapp is composed using Material Design for Bootstrap. Choose which flavor of MDBootstrap you’d like to use (or choose vanilla JS).

help.title: Learn more about building a front-end for your dapp.

children.name: access_control
children.title: Access Control
children.description: Once a smart contract has been deployed, you cannot change your code. Access Control Blocks give you granular control over who can manage your contracts and control their operation.

children.name: asset_value_tracking
children.title: Asset and Value Tracking
children.description: Create your own cryptocurrency tokens and track or trade digital assets. Tokens are divisible and one unit is not uniquely different from another unit of the same token (like currency). Collectibles are uniquely different‒ each unit of a collectible is different from any other (like trading cards).

children.name: nft
children.title: Non-fungible Tokens
children.description: Create a non-fungible token for tracking unique assets associated with your dapp.

children.name: file_storage
children.title: File Storage
children.description: Storing data on a blockchain is expensive so developers usually store a pointer to the data, called a hash, on the blockchain.

children.name: authentication
children.title: Authentication
children.description: In order to engage with most dapps, users need to authenticate. Accounts on a blockchain are generated deterministically, so users do not use standard logins like email or social sign-on. Users access their accounts by generating their private key, which allows them to authorize transactions on their account.

children.name: collection
children.title: Collection
children.description: Many smart contracts require managing a collection of entities. Blocks in this category provide solutions for different collection scenarios.

name: recipes
title: Recipes
description: Recipes are ready-made DappStarter projects based on popular choices
